definitions: Made an unjust or prejudicial distinction in the treatment of different categories of people or things, especially on the grounds of race, sex, or age.
Recognized or perceived the difference between two or more things.
Treated someone worse than others because of their race, gender, religion, etc.
examples: The company discriminated against older applicants.
He discriminated between the genuine and the fake.
They felt discriminated against due to their accent.
